channel.title: Normal
channel.description:
Do you think there is normal? I don't because of one reason:
Normal is how society defines you. What you may think as "Normal" may be weird to others.
What do YOU think normal is?
Discuss

item.title: Normal
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The Reaper X:

Someone explain the difference to mean between a person with a Narcissistic Personality Disorder and a selfish and arrogant person, not diagnosed by a doctor.

NPD implies true delusions of grandeur/lack of empathy, rather than realising you’re not better than anyone else but choosing to ignore it (being selfish).

Read full topic

item.title: Normal
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

didn’t i make a thread exactly like this?

My opinion was:

[b]There is no normal, except how society 'defines' it. [/b]

exactly. just like on a time line. when society started, it didn’t start at a point. it started in a process. more than one exact time. normality isn’t all the same. different places, areas, cultures have their own “normal”. everything and one is different according to how they’ve lived, their experiences with other people, and their choices. you can’t put a definition around what normal is.

I gave some quotes i got from the post i did earlier on another forum also:

There is no normal, except how society 'defines' it. But why should we go along with what society has said?

Everyone has something wrong with them. Everyone should be in a mental hospitals and getting meds for this reason or that. Someone explain the difference to mean between a person with a Narcissistic Personality Disorder and a selfish and arrogant person, not diagnosed by a doctor.

Abnormality can be defined by...

-Inability to function adequately
-Falling outside of statistical norms
-Falling out of social norms

and another one i cant remember

it is what that person's habits are. what one person's norm is different than another person's. yet in society sense it is whatever doesn't fit in with that certain way of thinking. the society's morals and what have you.

Everything on earth that we say is opinionated in some way. That’s what creates normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Normal
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The definition of normal is not really debatable.

Normal = Displaying qualities typical of a given set.

It makes no difference whether abnormal behaviour is right/wrong/strange… it is still abnormal if it’s nto a typical quality of the given set of people. Words can’t be redefined to suit people who don’t like to consider themselves “abnormal”.

Read full topic
